Message:
The lives of my subjects
belong to me.
’Tis for mine own sake
that they live and die.

If so it be, there should be
no issue if I decide even
when one lives or dies.
I shall not let thee die, Asahi.

Do not dare think of dying
without my permission.
As such...

“Each and every one of thee
shall bequeath your lives
unto Asahi.”

If I could slowly drain
tiny slivers of life
from many a person,
and channel it to Asahi...

Then, as if responding
to my desire,
a fog enshrouds the land,
and begins draining the life
from my subjects.

With this much,
it shall amount to Asahi’s life...

Suddenly...voices crying out
in pain reach mine ears.

Why do they sound so pained?
I am taking but tiny slivers...

As the countless pleas
resound in mine ears,
I hear that whisper once more.

“This is what you
wished for, isn’t it?”

Verily... I did wish for this...
What would befall the lives
of others mattered not to me.
